title: Acetaminophen Overdose and NAC Dosing
description: Calculates PO/IV N-acetylcysteine (NAC) dosing for acetaminophen overdose and determines toxicity based on the Rumack-Matthew nomogram

parameters.name: hours_since_ingestion
parameters.description: Hours since acetaminophen ingestion (optional, for nomogram assessment)

parameters.name: acetaminophen_level
parameters.description: Serum acetaminophen level (optional, for nomogram assessment)

result.name: nac_dosing
result.description: NAC dosing regimen and toxicity assessment

ranges.interpretation: Probable hepatic toxicity. Immediate NAC treatment is indicated.
Hepatic toxicity unlikely. NAC treatment typically not needed unless clinical concern.

references: Rumack BH, Matthew H. Acetaminophen poisoning and toxicity. Pediatrics. 1975 Jun;55(6):871-6. PMID: 1134886.

Ershad M, Naji A, Patel P, Vearrier D. N-Acetylcysteine. [Updated 2024 Feb 29]. In: StatPearls [Internet]. Treasure Island (FL): StatPearls Publishing; 2025 Jan-. Available from: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK537183/

Prescott LF, Illingworth RN, Critchley JA, Stewart MJ, Adam RD, Proudfoot AT. Intravenous N-acetylcystine: the treatment of choice for paracetamol poisoning. Br Med J. 1979 Nov 3;2(6198):1097-100. PMID: 519312.
Hodgman MJ, Garrard AR. A review of acetaminophen poisoning. Crit Care Clin. 2012 Oct;28(4):499-516. doi: 10.1016/j.ccc.2012.07.006. PMID: 22998987.
formula: IV Protocol (21-hour): Loading dose: 150 mg/kg over 60 min; Second dose: 50 mg/kg over 4 hours; Third dose: 100 mg/kg over 16 hours. Oral Protocol (72-hour): Loading dose: 140 mg/kg; Maintenance: 70 mg/kg every 4 hours for 17 doses. Rumack-Matthew nomogram: Treatment line at 4 hours = 150 mcg/mL, declining logarithmically.
notes: NAC is almost 100% effective if given within 8 hours post-ingestion
The Rumack-Matthew nomogram is only valid for single acute ingestions between 4-24 hours
For patients with fluid restrictions or <40 kg, IV NAC volumes should be adjusted
Monitor for anaphylactoid reactions with IV NAC (up to 18% of patients)
Oral NAC should be diluted to 5% and mixed with juice for palatability
